Ok context

The last EF5 tornado occurred in 2013, and between then there have been many controversially rated tornadoes that didnt get the EF5 rating.

original_text:
Instead of a normal cycle, Melissa underwent a rarer type sometimes called a 'MERC' or Merger Eyewall Replacement Cycle, though also known as an Eyewall Merger.

The two eyewalls merged together, becoming a much more intense and slightly larger one just before landfall. You can see the process here.

original_text:
For the first time, data about gun violence and use in Colorado has been gathered in one place so people can see the stark numbers.

Since 2014, Colorado has endured 60 mass shootings that killed 88 people and injured 239. In 2022 alone, there were 13 mass shootings, with 33 killed and 41 injured.
author: npr.org

original_text: The Palestinian architect and mother of two could hear Israeli fighter jets rumbling overhead as air strikes took out the building next to hers. Bodies were being pulled from the rubble. She was trying to shield her children from scenes of death all around.

original_text: A ransomware attack is disrupting pharmacies and hospitals nationwide, leaving patients with problems filling prescriptions or seeking medical treatment.
author: npr.org

original_text: Kevin Monahan was sentenced to 25 years to life for the murder of a Schuylerville woman this morning in a driveway shooting last year that garnered national attention.

original_text: As the wildfires in the Texas Panhandle continue leaving scorched homes, barns and livestock in their wake, some residents are beginning to glimpse what recovery will look like when the blazes are finally extinguished.

author: npr.org

original_text: Three National Guard soldiers and a Border Patrol agent were on board when a helicopter crashed near the Mexican border. A soldier was seriously injured.

original_text: NPR's Scott Simon recounts the heroic actions of a Chicago bus driver and his passengers, who saw buildings on fire at 2 a.m. and raced to warn residents.
author: npr.org

original_text: A felony trial for Alec Baldwin is set to begin in four months, as prosecutors in New Mexico pursue charges of involuntary manslaughter against the actor over the shooting death of cinematographer Halyna Hutchins on the set of the film Rust in 2021.
author: npr.org

original_text: A Kansas family remembers Valentine's Day as the start of panic attacks, life-altering trauma and waking to nightmares of gunfire. They wonder how they'll recover from the Kansas City parade shooting.

original_text: Tucked away in the attic of a Massachusetts home was not one, not two â€” but 22 pieces of stolen Japanese antiques, including a hand-drawn map, ceramics and portraits of Okinawan kings, some dating back as far as the 1700's.

original_text: The largest medical facility in Gaza, Al-Shifa Hospital, was the site of a raid by the Israeli military early Monday morning, with reports of gunshots, a fire breaking out on the complex and an unknown number of people injured and potentially killed.
author: npr.org

original_text: Russian news agencies report between two and five gunmen killed at least 10 people at a concert venue on the outskirts of Moscow Friday. A fire has broken out on the premises, endangering more lives, with flames visible from miles away.
author: npr.org

original_text: Vice President Harris on Saturday is set to make a push for greater use of red flag laws when she visits Parkland, Fla., where one of the deadliest school shootings on record in the United States happened in 2018.
author: npr.org

original_text: The death toll from a mass shooting at a concert hall on the outskirts of Moscow Friday evening has risen to at least 133 people, as emergency responders continued to clear away the rubble. At least another 145 others were reported injured.
author: npr.org

original_text: Part of a bridge in Baltimore collapsed early Tuesday after a container ship crashed into it, sending cars and people into the water in what authorities are calling a "developing mass casualty event." Follow along for live updates: n.pr/4aakjma
author: npr.org

original_text: Women who are pregnant or who have recently given birth in Gaza face serious challenges amid daily airstrikes, continued ground fighting, high rates of disease and a growing lack of food and water.
author: npr.org

original_text: The deadly Francis Scott Key Bridge collapse blocked off much of Baltimore's harbor, which handles more cars and trucks than any other U.S. port. Companies have some options to keep imports coming.

original_text: Rain, thunderstorms and gray skies over large swaths of the path of totality are threatening to block views on April 8. Here's how to make the most of the rare event.

original_text: Since fighting broke out between the Sudanese Armed Forces and rebel paramilitaries a year ago, experts estimate over 14,000 people have been killed and millions displaced and facing starvation.

original_text: The recent deadly heat in West Africa is driven by human activities, including the burning of fossil fuels, particularly in the wealthy Northern Hemisphere, according to an international report.

original_text: Violence erupted at UCLA on Tuesday night after pro-Israel demonstrators attempted to forcibly dismantle an encampment of dozens of tents set up by pro-Palestinian protesters.

The Pacific Palisades and surrounding areas will reopen after the Palisades Fire tore through nearly 40 square miles of homes, commercial areas and wilderness â€“ more than three weeks after the fire started in early January. Both the Palisades and Eaton fires are now 100% contained.

original_text: After thousands of homes were destroyed, many are looking for ways to make Los Angeles safer from wildfires. But clearing dense shrubs on the hillsides could actually make the fire danger worse.

original_text:
A high-pressure system is pushing Arctic air into the central U.S. this week. 

Much of the country will experience plunging temperatures, while states such as Kansas and Missouri could see heavy snow.

original_text: As Los Angeles begins a slow recovery from destructive and deadly wildfires, local planners are trying to strike a balance between expediting rebuilding and public safety.

original_text: A major storm sweeps across the U.S., bringing severe weather conditions such as blizzards, wildfires and tornadoes. Blizzard warnings are in effect for Nebraska, Kansas, Missouri, Iowa and Minnesota.

original_text: DFS Special Operations staff delivered Rehab 6 to support the #LakevilleMA Fire Department in single-digit temps last week. Learn how our Rehab units and other Special Ops assets can support your local fire department 24 hours a day, 7 days a week: ow.ly/9A8950UNJ5Y
author: massdfs.bsky.social

original_text: DFS Special Operations staff supported #ConcordMA FD with a Rehab Unit and a drone at their 2-alarm house fire last week. These and other assets are available to support firefighter health/safety and assist incident commanders at large-scale or long-duration incidents: www.mass.gov/info-details...

original_text: #Remember: 130 years ago today, a fire at the Hutchinson Hardware Store claimed the lives of #LynnMA Fire Depâ€™t Capt. Henry Skinner, Firefighter John Donlan, Firefighter Abraham Moody Jr, & Firefighter Thomas Murray. We honor their ultimate sacrifice and the loved ones left behind.
author: massdfs.bsky.social

original_text: #Remember: On this date in 2003, the devastating fire at #TheStation in RI, claimed 100 lives. Massachusetts adopted many life-saving measures in response, including #Sprinkler and #CrowdManager requirements for nightclubs, but we still need to stay aware in clubs and elsewhere.
author: massdfs.bsky.social

original_text: DFS Special Operations staff recently delivered Rehab 5 to support the Springfield Fire Department as they battled an early-morning two-alarm fire in the freezing cold. These & other operational support resources are always available to local fire departments. Visit ow.ly/vr8A50V0exI to learn more!
author: massdfs.bsky.social

original_text: DFS Special Operations staff supported #ChicopeeMA FD at the scene of a recent fire that broke out in the subfreezing overnight hours. They delivered Rehab 5, stocked with coffee, hot cocoa, snacks, and a calm place to warm up after battling a two-alarm fire -- and the elements.
author: massdfs.bsky.social

original_text: Last year, the #WalthamMA Fire Dep't fought a 3-alarm house fire that caused major damage, but a bedroom with a closed door was nearly untouched. These pics from the State Police Fire Investigation Unit show that closing your door when you sleep can make a dramatic difference in survivability.
author: massdfs.bsky.social

original_text: #TechRescue Tuesday: A few seats are still available for the Mass Fire Academy's Structural Collapse Shoring Module in Bridgewater this weekend! The course focuses on knowledge, skills, and equipment necessary to safely shore up damaged structures. Register using course code 771: ow.ly/tEvO50VeKaz.
author: massdfs.bsky.social

original_text: On Sunday, the #HolyokeMA Fire Department responded to a fire and explosion that started with an e-bike's lithium-ion battery and seriously injured a resident. There's a lot of power packed into these batteries, so be sure to use, store, & charge them safely! Read more: ow.ly/ST6L50Vhho6
author: massdfs.bsky.social

original_text: Today is #WorldWaterDay! Water is firefighters' oldest tool -- and the faster, the better! When a house fire broke out in an area without hydrants this week, #GranbyMA FD responded to find it contained and extinguished by #HomeFireSprinklers. Read more: ow.ly/tYlx50Vmoxs
author: massdfs.bsky.social

original_text: DFS Special Operations staff delivered Rehab units to support firefighters in Lawrence, Brockton, and Westford at two structure fires and a wide area search last week. These and other assets are always available to assist at emergencies and planned events: ow.ly/6H4K50VpJem
author: massdfs.bsky.social

original_text: The Mass Fire Academy recently delivered its Rope Rescue Operational Level course for #BrocktonMA firefighters. This curriculum will serve them well and support many other tech rescue disciplines in the future. Great work by all our students, instructors, and support staff!

original_text: The first personnel at the scene of yesterday's fatal fire in #MarlboroughMA reported that they did not hear smoke alarms on arrival. author: massdfs.bsky.social

original_text: We set two identical fires in two identical rooms -- but one was protected by home fire sprinklers. Which outcome would you prefer for your home and family? Thanks to #EasthamptonMA Fire Department for hosting our trailer for this powerful demonstration!
author: massdfs.bsky.social

original_text: Massachusetts fire incidents climbed 3% last year, driven by an 11% increase in outdoor fires like the ones we saw during the fall. Fatal fires were most common in single-family homes, and the most common known factor was smoking. More fact sheets & data: ow.ly/pwXR50W7SNN!
author: massdfs.bsky.social

original_text: #OTD in 1949, #Smokejumper Joseph P. Sylvia of Plymouth MA suffered fatal injuries in the #MannGulchFire at Helena National Forest in Montana. author: massdfs.bsky.social

original_text: 151 years ago today, Henry S. Parmalee received a patent for the first automatic fire sprinkler head. Properly installed and maintained #HomeFireSprinklers remain the most effective way to protect people, pets, and property from fire until firefighters arrive. Learn more at homefiresprinkler.org!
author: massdfs.bsky.social

original_text: #CrashCourse: Massachusetts Firefighting Academy recruits get hands-on training in stabilizing a vehicle and using a variety of cutters, spreaders, rams, and hand tools for extricating occupants. Like all the skills they learn, these are taught by firefighters with years of real-world experience.
author: massdfs.bsky.social

original_text: Entering a burning building is inherently dangerous -- and fire isn't the only hazard. At the Massachusetts Fire Academy, instructors train recruits on how to rescue a brother or sister firefighter who has fallen through a weakened floor. These recruits are using a handline, one of several methods.
author: massdfs.bsky.social

original_text: DFS staff recently rehabbed our side-by-side sprinkler trailer after a demonstration. Furniture from the left chamber sustained minor damage; there's no furniture on the right because it was destroyed by fire. Properly installed and maintained sprinklers protect you & your home!

original_text:
Pinellas Park, FL F3 #Tornado â€“ October 3, 1992!

An F3 tornado struck Pinellas Park, destroying 87 mobile homes, heavily damaging 63 more, and killing three people. It crossed neighborhoods, businesses, and Pinellas Park High School before dissipating. buff.ly/9ueLl8c #flwx #OTD #tornadohistory
author: tornadotalk.bsky.social

original_text:
Now on #Spotify! This Week in #Tornado #History!

buff.ly/NYFvhab

original_text: New Smyrna Beach, FL F3 #Tornado â€“ Nov 2, 1997! A late-night tornado raced through New Smyrna Beach, carving a 3-mile path from near US 1 to the Atlantic. It damaged schools, destroyed homes in Venetian Villas & Diamond Head Condominiums, & injured 32 people. buff.ly/yjHFIWC #flwx

original_text: Scattered severe thunderstorms are possible in parts of the central and southern High Plains late this afternoon into tonight.  Large to very large hail and severe wind gusts (60-80 mph) are the primary threats. Visit weather.gov for your local forecast.
author: nws.noaa.gov

original_text: Large to very large hail and damaging winds will be possible this afternoon and evening over parts of the central/southern High Plains. Additional strong to severe storms are probable in the Northwest during the afternoon. Visit weather.gov for the latest in your area.
author: nws.noaa.gov

original_text: Red Flag Warnings are in effect today (August 4) across Utah, Idaho, Wyoming, and Colorado. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. These conditions will linger across portions of the western U.S. on Tuesday and Wednesday.
author: nws.noaa.gov

original_text: A Red Flag Warning is issued when critical fire weather conditions are happening or about to happen. It does not necessarily mean there is a fire, but that conditions will be dry and windy. If a fire is present, it can become extreme! Avoid activities that could spark a wildfire! weather.gov/safety
author: nws.noaa.gov

original_text: Extreme heat is possible this week across the Desert Southwest, with the peak of the most intense heat by mid-week. original_text: ICYMI: The updated NOAA Atlantic Hurricane Season outlook is that the May prediction remains on track for above-normal Atlantic hurricane season. original_text: ðŸ§µ The Dragon Bravo Fire, ignited by a lightning strike on July 4, 2025, on the North Rim of Grand Canyon National Park in Arizona. As of August 11 the blaze has burned more than 143,000 acres and reached 44% containment as firefighting efforts continue.
author: nws.noaa.gov

original_text: In the heart of this response, the science of wildland firefighting plays a pivotal role: NWS Incident Meteorologist Robert Rickey & Fire Behavior Analysts Stewart Turner and Richard Sinkovitz observe conditions on the ground, drawing on data from Incident Remote Automatic Weather Stations(IRAWS)...
author: nws.noaa.gov

original_text: ...direct weather reports from fire crews, and other vital sources to deliver accurate forecasts and analyses. This information empowers key leaders and fire crews from across the region to make informed decisions, enhancing safety and strategy in combating this historic fire.
author: nws.noaa.gov
